item.title: VP, Technical Accounting & External Reporting
item.description:
As guardians of the Nielsen Media assets, our Finance teams strive to accurately report the financial position of Nielsen. We seek to continuously improve finance processes, controls and systems. We aim to provide clear, simple and insightful financial information to our business leaders in order to drive positive financial action. As a team we work in the spirit of integrity, accountability, quality and diligence, whilst maintaining the highest ethical standard
Reporting directly to the Controller & Chief Accounting Officer, the VP Technical Accounting & External Reporting plays a critical role in organizational success as a trusted partner to the finance and accounting team and commercial leadership. They are responsible for the oversight and execution of the vision, strategic direction and performance of the technical accounting and external reporting function. In this position, they will ensure regulatory compliance with SEC, FASB and IFRS requirements. This individual will be responsible for the preparation of the consolidated financial statements for SEC filings and other regulatory compliance. In addition, this individual will oversee the company’s accounting policies, implement new accounting standards and provide technical accounting consultation on new or complex transactions.
The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. They will be a strong communicator with the ability to build effective partnerships with the finance and accounting teams and with the commercial organization.

item.title: VP, Product Communications
item.description:
Job Title: VP, Product Communications Reports to Job Title: SVP, Head of Global Communications Business Unit: Marketing and Communications Location: Remote but New York, San Francisco preferred
Marketing & Communications - Nielsen As stewards of the Nielsen brand and reputation, we drive company growth through compelling marketing and communications initiatives. Living our values of inclusion, courage and growth, we enable Nielsen to power a better media future for all people.
About this job We are looking for a highly motivated, experienced and mature leader as the VP of Product Communications to create compelling product narratives and communications strategies to support Nielsen’s growth and thought leadership objectives. As a senior leader in Nielsen’s marketing and communications organization, this role will lead and oversee the communications strategies of all of Nielsen’s products - audience measurement, impact and Gracenote.
Nielsen is a leading global data and analytics company that provides a holistic and objective understanding of the media industry. This role will focus on driving visibility for Nielsen’s products, its differentiators, and communicating key value propositions through effective, highly strategic and surgical storytelling.
Scope of this role This role will lead a team of about 10 communications professionals to drive all external communications programs for the company’s products. This individual will collaborate most closely with product marketing and more broadly with the marketing communications team to align and agree on the strategy for content, demand generation, digital/social media and brand marketing activities. The VP of Communications will also be responsible for leveraging the product and commercial leadership for thought leadership, media interviews, speaking engagements and social media.
Candidates must have experience leading a product communications team and managing remote teams to develop and execute holistic communications strategies. The ideal candidate must be capable of translating complex subjects into digestible messages and have a curiosity about how technology and the media ecosystem works.

item.title: VP, Data Partnerships
item.description:
As a product-led organization, Global Nielsen Media puts the product at the center of the strategy and brings cross-functional teams together to work on particular products. With over 2,800 global patents in over 80 countries, the Product team drives value with cutting-edge solutions and analytics to create insights. Be a part of creating the innovative solutions that define the media ecosystem playing field and enable media markets to function
ABOUT THE ROLE As the world’s largest research organization, Nielsen is powered by talented, creative scientists, researchers and engineers. Our associates come from diverse disciplines that include business, economics, engineering, marketing, mathematics, operations research and statistics. These professionals drive innovation and insight through continual ideation, complex analyses and delivery of insights to our clients. Because measurement is at the core of Nielsen's business, our products have high visibility and make a direct impact on our clients.
Our organization has an open position for a VP Data Partnerships. As VP Data Partnerships, your core focus will be to identify and build data partnerships within the media ecosystem to support and innovate the core Nielsen deliverables across planning, activation, measurement and identity. The successful candidate must have a willingness to work in an evolving team that is constantly growing, an extensive knowledge of the advertising and promotion ecosystem, and a thorough understanding of the importance of data to measurement and analytics. In addition you must have mastery in understanding how data is collected, collection implications on our clients, what our clients are looking for in the use of data, and an ability to create highly informed strategies based on the analytics and source data.

item.title: TV Data Entry Operator
item.description:
Global Nielsen Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. At the core of our data is our Field & Call Center associates, who connect and build personal relationships with consumers to collect data on TV, Radio, and Digital Device consumption.
ABOUT THE ROLE
The role involves identifying on-air placements of television advertisements, programmes, and promotions. You will be working towards our daily data delivery to clients. You will watch and listen to video playback, to identify the programmes and advertisements on TV. You will audio transcribe commercials that have appeared on broadcast tv, and you will input this information into the Nielsen database following a style-guide
HOURS
The morning shift starts at 6 AM and is approximately 5-6 hours per day. The evening shift starts at 6 PM and is approximately 3-4 hours per day. Reliable transport for these times is essential. This is a desk-based role. Our offices are located in Takapuna, Auckland. In the event of changing Covid-19 alert levels, work will be undertaken from home.
Option 1 (Variable Morning or Evening Shifts) This is a permanent part-time role, in the range of 9-18 hours per week. You will work a set schedule of 3 or 4 x fixed shifts per week.
Option 2 (Morning Shifts) This is a permanent part-time role, in the range of 25-30 hours per week. You will work a set schedule of 5x fixed morning shifts per week.
Please indicate your preferred working days in your application and your availability for mornings and/or evenings.

item.title: Thesis Internship - Brand Impact Project Teams
item.description:
Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. Our team of researchers come from diverse disciplines and they drive innovation, new product ideation, experimental design and testing, complex analysis and delivery of data insights around the world. We support all International Media clients and are located where our clients are.
Thesis Internship - Data Science
Do you dream of working for one of the global leaders in data science & media, but you still have to complete your studies? You’ve come to the right place. We offer econometrics / operations research / mathematics students the possibility to write their MSc thesis on an applied topic in the field of media while simultaneously working in a data science team on actual client projects. Do you want to kick-start your career as a data scientist? And are you passionate about data and modeling? Join our data science team!
Who are we?
We are a team of over 25 data scientists, all with a strong analytical background, working in the landscape of media analytics. Our goal is to provide the best solutions to major clients all around the globe. As a young and international team, we are continuously working on improving both our hard and soft skills, and are always on the lookout for new talent. Our team has several spots for thesis internships open every year. During an internship, you will work as a Junior Data Scientist in one of our client project teams that help brands in their media evaluation using advanced statistical techniques, such as Bayesian regression modeling. Together with your project team you will translate the modeling results into insights and recommendations for the client.
What is the role?
You will be writing your MSc thesis with us for three days a week, while you’ll spend the other two days a week working in one of our client project teams on: * Processing, analyzing and modeling data from various sources within a small project team working towards a client delivery * Making decisions about data, methodology, and modeling within a project to ensure the quality of the outcomes, and discuss progress and issues with the project leads * Contributing to technical improvements of existing solutions
What are the requirements?
* Currently enrolled in a Master in Econometrics, Mathematics, or other quantitative MSc * Some experience in Python and/or R programming * Some experience with regression and classification models * Good command in spoken and written English * Available for 40 hours a week * Available for a period of (at least) 7 months * Residing in the Netherlands
Why do I want to work here?
* Competitive salary and benefits14 days of paid leave * Reimbursement of travel expenses * Hybrid work; you choose how often you want to work from the office vs home * Personal and professional development opportunities, regular check-ins with your personal manager, and the option of joining internal training sessions * Access to Nielsen’s own learning platform and data science course library * An open and international atmosphere, in terms of colleagues, clients & overall mindset * A wide set of year-round organized social events, both team wide and office wide * An informal office culture, with e.g. table football & table tennis, and frequently occurring drinks * The possibility to spend 24 working hours on (local) volunteering, for instance during our Annual Nielsen volunteering day * Opportunity to join one of Nielsen’s business resource group and focus on driving diversity, equity and inclusion * Exposure to a large range of other Nielsen initiatives, such as our peer-to-peer recognition program, mentoring program, trivia, book clubs, virtual yoga classes, and many more!

item.title: Team Lead, Live Data Production (Latam Soccer)
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
Team Lead, Live Data Production, Latam Soccer Location: Oldsmar, FL
Are you passionate about sports, specifically Latam soccer? Come check out our team!
Passion for sports, leadership, and data collection, that’s what we are looking for in our new Team Lead for the Gracenote Sports Content team, which specializes in Latam soccer. Labeled the Live Data Production (LDP) team, this team already has hubs in Canada, India, the Netherlands, and South Korea. This new team will be located in Oldsmar, FL, USA.
As a Team Lead you will help build this new team to capture live sports data from mostly Latam soccer leagues, such as the Mexican Liga MX, the Brazilian Série A and the Copa Libertadores. You will direct a team of four supervisors, who in turn have the lead over a large group of office-based and remote part-time staff who work the games.
What will you be responsible for? • Build and lead a team of initially 4 full-time supervisors and 30 part-time live scoring staff, who will work when soccer games are happening • Ensure staff is hired, trained, and scheduled in an efficient manner. • Evaluate the performance of staff and ensure we provide the right feedback so our team can become successful. • Ensure work is executed per predefined standards and processes. • Continuously look for opportunities to improve or grow the Latam soccer operations. • Work together with international LDP teams to organize training, and to make sure each location can support each other during peak times. • Be a bridge between the Oldsmar LDP team and other Nielsen/Gracenote teams, including Engineering, Facilities or Infrastructure.
What are we looking for? • Fluent in English. Fluent in Spanish. • Proven management skills, and experience with working with shift-based staff preferred. • Strong coaching and communication skills, ability to give feedback in a constructive and clear manner. • Cool under pressure, working with live sports can get a little hectic at times. • Flexible schedule - evening and weekend work is required. • Passions for sports and soccer in particular.
#LI-JR1

item.title: Team Lead - Operations (Japanese Language)
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
ABOUT THE ROLE
This role is responsible for working with the global market leader in sport sponsorship media valuation and research. To shape together with an ever-growing department, becoming key to our business worldwide. To be part of a diverse and talented international team with opportunities for personal and professional development. A growth culture with an entrepreneurial mindset supported by a world-leading operations network and toolkit.
RESPONSIBILITIES
As a candidate, you should be able to speak, read and write typical Japanese words (mostly brand or branding-related terminology including taglines/claims). You are expected to have business-level J-E and E-J translation skills. Review and validate brand exposure data, ensuring data adheres to our extensive quality checks, and compare versus previous events/seasons. Check that all brands and locations specified in the tracking requirements have been fully covered and highlight any issues to Data Operation team. Provide brand confirmations to Data Operations team when required. Apply advertising rates to broadcasts (eg. various rates used depending on time of the week/day/type of programme, etc.) and upload into our internal system. Communicate with internal stakeholders (Media Analytics and Client Service teams) regarding project requirements and delegate project requirements (for Print measurement, Broadcasting schedule collation and Audio exposure analysis) and agreeing timelines with external third party data providers and freelancers based in Japan.
QUALIFICATION
Graduate / Bachelor’s Degree Foreign Language - Japanese Skill Certification - N2 Level Japanese Language certificate (Or equivalent) 2-5 Overall Experience (Min 1 Year after N2) A keen interest in Sports is essential N2 level Japanese language required Strong attention to detail Advanced knowledge of MS Excel (Lookup formulas, IF statements, Pivot tables etc.) required High level of self-organization and prioritization Ability to work under pressure to fulfill delivery deadlines
BONUS QUALIFICATIONS:
Ability to manage multiple stakeholders Ability to work with a team of 20 - 30 associates and supervisors (servicing Japan) Ability to carry out team/operations related administrative chores Excellent written and verbal communication in English Ability to meet deadlines
ABOUT THE TEAM
Nielsen Sports is the leading source of sports measurement and analytics around the world, with solutions spanning cross-platform media valuation, fan insights, and digital and social analysis. Only Nielsen provides a comprehensive, fair playing field for the business of media. Our unbiased metrics create the shared understanding of the industry required for markets to function. Nielsen Sports is on a transformational path of driving change to achieve near term goal of market competitiveness and long-term goal of market leadership. As part of this drive, Nielsen Sports Operations is constantly exploring & leveraging practices, processes, tools and expertise, with primary focus on building operational capability.
ABOUT NIELSEN
We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.
We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what’s next with us at Nielsen: www.nielsen.com & www.gracenote.com.
#LI-ST1 Nielsen Sports

item.title: Stagiaire Assistant Chargé D’étude Insight & Opinion
item.description:
Poste basé à Bezons (95)
Leader en France et dans le monde, Nielsen Sports, une division de Nielsen Media, est le leader mondial indépendant du conseil et de l’évaluation du marketing sportif auprès des acteurs-clés du secteur. En combinant ses solutions permettant d’évaluerl’efficacité du sponsoring et ses données sur les fans de sport avec la compréhension exhaustive du comportement des consommateurs et leur consommation média, Nielsen Sports offre un positionnement unique pour aider les entreprises à optimiser leur réussite commerciale.
Dans le cadre de son développement, Nielsen Sports France recherche un(e) Stagiaire Assistant Chargé(e) D’étude Insight & Opinion. Au sein de l’équipe Market Research, vous serez amené(e) à travailler sur les problématiques marketing / communication / business des grands annonceurs du sport, des institutions sportives, des organisateurs d’événements ou des médias.
VOS MISSIONS
Sous la responsabilité d’un Account Director, vos missions sont les suivantes :
Accompagnement sur l’ensemble des étapes d’une étude :
- Set up du questionnaire et suivi de la phase de recueil des données - Vérification des données recueillies et réflexion sur les cibles d’analyse - Mise en forme et interprétation des résultats (en français et/ou anglais) - Rédaction des synthèses et participation à l’élaboration des recommandations marketing - Contact permanent avec les interlocuteurs sur le projet (équipes Nielsen Sports, prestataires,…)
Support sur les activités des autres pôles de Nielsen Sports France : Media Evaluation (analyse des données médias), Digital et Consulting.

You will be the center point of contact at Nielsen for your clients, responsible for revenue growth and value creation, identifying new opportunities within each business, deepening the relationship with existing constituents, cultivating relationships with new stakeholders, and coordinating cross-functionally within Nielsen. The ideal candidate will have a strong track record of winning new business, understand and be fluent in both the TV and Digital media planning and buying process, possess excellent written and oral communication skills, have strong analytical skills, be passionate about digital media, be adaptable to changes in this fast paced industry and be comfortable managing a revenue target. item.description:

Digital Director, Business Development – Agency Nielsen Audience Activation Unit
Nielsen is looking for a Director, Business Development to join our Audience Activation team. This talented team focuses on empowering brands and their agencies to connect more directly with customers by combining Nielsen’s world-class data, analytics, media planning, marketing activation and data management platform capabilities. The data synergies facilitate a deeper understanding of consumers, more effective one-to-one messaging, and superior ROI analysis and campaign optimization.

We are looking for dynamic sellers who are client focused and have a history of success in Sales. Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of the digital advertising ecosystem. Bottom line – we are looking for a talented seller who knows how to prospect, pitch and close. ABOUT NIELSEN We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.
We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless.

item.title: Sr. Data Scientist
item.description:
Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. Our team of researchers come from diverse disciplines and they drive innovation, new product ideation, experimental design and testing, complex analysis and delivery of data insights around the world. We support all International Media clients and are located where our clients are.
Sr. Data Scientist Data Science - New York City Area Preferred / Full Remote Available
What is the role? Who am I working with? The Activation Data Science team focuses on creating and scaling audience segments for digital activation. Using our expertise in big data, predictive modeling, and automation, we produce and manage thousands of machine learning models at scale. This enables marketers to optimize their campaigns by engaging devices, individuals, and households with targeted messaging.
Our audience scaling models contribute directly to revenue and client retention. We work closely with our product and client teams to determine priorities for model production and pipeline feature development. This Data Scientist role will specialize in managing ML operations, client interaction, and product analytics. The role will also contribute to ETL workflows, methodological discussions, and implementation of ML techniques.
This is an ideal opportunity for a Data Scientist to apply their technical knowledge in a dynamic and innovative business environment.
Must Have confident communication skills! Be able to communicate clearly and logically to stakeholders, clients and management.
What will I do? Manage, evaluate, and maintain ML models at scale Manage development of production code that integrates seamlessly into our ML pipeline Develop and automate processes to support end-to-end ML workflows, from ETL to development to deployment Support the product and commercial teams through data analysis and investigation Drive product strategy by applying Data Science methods to address business needs Present and explain Data Science findings and methods to internal and external clients Stay up to date on industry changes in digital activation (e.g. new devices and platforms, privacy and regulation, changes in browser/app measurement) and critically assess how it would impact Nielsen’s business Participate in internal and external knowledge exchanges (conferences, workshops, webinars)
Is this for me? This position requires a detail-oriented person who can problem-solve and work independently on critical initiatives while understanding the big picture.
Required Requirements Minimum of 3 years work experience in data science and analytics Bachelor’s degree in statistics, STEM, or comparable work experience (M.S. preferred) Experience leading and managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders Strong communication skills, ability to explain complex problems to non-technical audiences Experience working with relational databases and strong knowledge of SQL Proficiency in Python and relevant data science libraries (e.g. numpy, pandas, sci-kit learn) Experience analyzing and investigating large data sets Naturally curious, has a passion for solving problems and critical thinking Good vibes, integrity, and strong work ethic
Preferred Skills Experience in the ad tech industry Experience with technical product management and feature development Experience developing ML models and deploying them to production Experience working with cloud-based computing and storage solutions (preferably AWS) Experience working with Bash and Git, data visualization tools (e.g. Superset), and other tools common to the data science world (e.g. Airflow, Spark, MLlib, MLflow, Tensorflow, and PyTorch)
#LI-SF1 ABOUT NIELSEN As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth. Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

item.title: Sr. Data Engineer
item.description:
Nielsen Media would not function without our Technology teams! We are catalysts for delivery quality, on-time, reliable measurements to clients, and we are cultivators, growing our employees through education, skill building and experiences. Around the globe, our Technology teams are relentless in our pursuit of superior analytics, technology, process and support.
Nielsen‘s mission is to help marketers and media companies measure and improve advertising performance by accurately reporting on what consumers watch, see, or hear. In the Identity Platform Team, we are processing, in batch, billions of rows for the purpose of measuring our audience and calibrating against panelists. We have implemented this data pipeline with the following technologies:
Apache Spark (SQL) with Graphframes Trino (Presto) Apache Airflow AWS EMR, S3, and RDS Scala, Python and Spark/Trino SQL
So if you get excited by clustering in graphs, predicate pushdown in query execution, using typeclasses in scala and finding ways to make software less error-prone, then we have a job for you.

Title: Senior Data Scientist Division: Data Science
Where will I be? We are a growing workforce integrated throughout the US and Internationally, though this particular role will be based in the United States. Working hours? We encourage working similar hours as the rest of your team to ensure overlap needed for collaboration, though are flexible based on individual needs. Can I work remotely? Of course! You will work on both statistical research and code development by designing small and medium sized research projects based on abstract concepts. item.title: Sports Schedule Editor (French)
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
Sports Schedule Editor, French
ABOUT THIS JOB Gracenote Global Video Data is the definitive collection of worldwide TV, movie, and on-demand data. Top cable, satellite, OTT, and service providers around the world rely on Gracenote to power TV schedules, turbo charge video search, and discovery, and empower audiences to find and enjoy their favorite shows. With deep data describing movies and TV shows, including episode and series descriptions, genres, moods, and cast details, as well as live sports events, music, and more, Gracenote powers next-generation user interfaces and discovery engines. From TV listings to touchdowns, Gracenote is the first and only provider of descriptive data for Movies, TV, Sports, and Music, as well as stunning imagery on a global scale.
We are looking for a Schedule Editor who is proficient in French language. Responsible for the efficient processing and curation of television schedules specifically relating to sports content. It requires diligent workflow management to accurately process and update electronic programming guides (EPG) as they become available by different content providers. Schedule Editors are also responsible for maintaining, updating, and improving the Gracenote database that powers the consumer product and ultimately the end-user experience. Schedule Editors assist and report directly to Ingest Metadata Production Team Leaders, who manage all market-specific daily operations.The ideal candidate will be able to accurately process a high volume of entertainment metadata in a timely fashion. They will be able to manipulate this data, to normalize and enhance it for evergreen use in the Gracenote database.
RESPONSIBILITIES Acquire, normalize and enhance entertainment metadata (television electronic programming guides) from various content providers. Processing and manipulation of data required to ingest correctly into in-house software tools. High attention to detail is required to ensure that high-quality, accurate and timely, evergreen content is created in the Gracenote database. Investigate, query, and confirm questionable programming content when applicable. Run quality and assurance checks via systematic reports looking at the live database. Analyze and recommend process improvements. Contribute to team and department projects as assigned. Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS Proficient knowledge in French language Keen interest and broad sports knowledge are a real benefit for this position. Experience using computer software and databases, very good keyboarding skills. Data entry experience using content management systems beneficial. Experience with, or desire to work within a team, excellent communication skills. Must be able to work accurately under deadline. Good knowledge of television, movies and VOD programming is a plus, especially in the market language.
ABOUT THE TEAM The powerful combination of Nielsen and Gracenote brings together world-class entertainment metadata that helps millions of people find, discover and tune-in to entertainment they love with Nielsen’s audience measurement expertise about what people are actually watching, listening to and buying.
ABOUT NIELSEN As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth. Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action.
Gracenote, a Nielsen company, provides music, video, and sports content along with technologies to the world’s hottest entertainment products and brands. Gracenote is the global standard for music and video recognition which is supported by the largest source of entertainment data. Gracenote features descriptions of more than 200 million tracks, TV listings for 85+ countries and statistics from 4,500 sport leagues and competitions.

Nielsen is the largest media market research company in the world, tracking what people in over 100 countries have of preferences The media consumer world is changing at an unprecedented rate where media and commerce collide. At Nielsen, we focus on providing our customers with useful, practical, and meaningful tools to help them make strategic business decisions every day.

Role/About this job
Around here we’re all “numbers” people, but it’s the 1s and 0s behind our data that make what we do possible. Software engineers strike a balance between precision and disruption, between reliability and innovation. Nielsen is a tech company powering a better media future for all people — and we couldn’t do it without our engineers.

You will be working on the automation of processes, which help Nielsen clients to understand and make decisions on advertising campaigns across digital, mobile, TV, radio, print and cross-platform media. You will be handling international marketing data and providing interfaces to prestigious external- and internal clients.
In a cloud based and automated environment, you create or enhance software services. Close communication with product management ensures data quality and alignment on expectations.
You are familiar with common design patterns and industry standards. Developing complex applications? You’re up for that, too. You enjoy teamwork and can clearly communicate your ideas and technical solutions. You’re ready to put your experience to work and contribute to projects on a global scale. After all, you are curious and open minded for different programming languages, frameworks and architectures. You find ways to solve every bug and you have the passion to create back-end services and processing engines that will drive tomorrow. You’ll power a better media future.
Diversity in terms of personal backgrounds, perspectives and experiences is very important to Nielsen. We would like to welcome you to a team with software developers of different origins, ages, religions and beliefs, as well as a female team lead. Diversity and commitment in the field of careers, but also in social projects, are not just empty buzzwords for Nielsen, but are actively promoted in various initiatives.
Responsibilities
Write clean, concise, maintainable code and tests Actively participate in team code reviews and apply quality standards Drive innovation and automation at every step, from coding to deployment Implement best practices in development and operations Collaborate with product and other engineering teams
Desired experience/background and skills
1-3 years of hands-on software development The training to back your work: a master’s degree, bachelor’s degree, or, as we recognize there isn’t one formula for success, equivalent work experience Software Engineering Experience with Java and SQL; experience with Python and RESTful APIs Serverless application development in Amazon Web Services cloud (ideally familiar with more functionalities of the Amazon Web Services ecosystem) Fluency in spoken and written English, and optionally fluency or strong command of German (spoken and written)
What can we offer you as an employee of Nielsen Media
In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a varied area of ​​responsibility and an open corporate culture with many development opportunities. Above all, our employees appreciate the ability to work independently in a motivated and very friendly team. Social responsibility, open communication and living our values ​​are not only on our website but also in our daily work.
Job application, additional information and questions
Please apply by using the "apply" link in this job advertisement, and kindly submit your CV in English. We have a desire to fill this role as soon as possible, as soon as the right person has been found.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Accuracy is the name of the game, and we’ve got the data to prove it. If precision and quality are important to you, you’ll fit right in as a Senior Manager at Nielsen.
As a Senior Research Manager, you will be the lead for projects from a sub-unit of a prestigious client and will work closely with one of the senior account leaders. In this role, you will be responsible for overall client management and also supervising day to day project activities and ensuring delivery is as per Nielsen’s commitment to the client.
ROLE DETAILS
Client Management - You will be the Go-To person for the client for key large scale projects. You need to follow a consultative approach to ensure our client business questions are addressed. You will be responsible to ensure an ongoing engaging conversation with our clients. Challenging status quo and thinking out of the box is the need of the hour on a regular basis. Customised study design - There will be many instances where we need to provide customised solution / study design to address client questions. For your projects, you will work with your senior colleague in providing the right and optimal customised solution for the client. This also requires you to collate as much as secondary information, understand the category and make the right recommendations to the client. Research Instrument - You will guide your team to design the right questionnaire and at times design it yourselves, in case of any complicated research. Data Insighting and Presentation - You will spearhead all data insighting and presentation for your projects. Most of the deliverables are strategic in nature and you will have the opportunity to practice research consultancy though data insighting. Deliverables as per Commitment - You will be responsible for ensuring that the projects are executed well, issues anticipated and solutions provided and delivered as per Nielsen’s commitment. Time Management - An extremely important quality. You will be servicing clients who are growing significantly and therefore expectations from project TAT needs to be customised, keeping the end goal in mind. Team Management - You will have team members reporting directly to you and therefore you will be responsible for guiding and mentoring them.

item.title: Senior Procurement Analyst
item.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Nielsen is embarking on a transformational journey to modernize and streamline its end-to-end procurement processes. We need a skilled senior analyst to help our teams navigate these changes. We require an experienced professional with a strong foundation in procurement or finance-related fields who can unlock value for Nielsen by being part of a dynamic team as well as managing a number of procurement categories.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Strategically source a portfolio of products and services with an emphasis within given categories/sub-categories. The Senior Procurement Analyst will use tools, processes, and strategies to drive and achieve business results. Competitively source assigned category spend (i.e. Travel, Professional Services, Consulting, BPO) through engagement of strategic suppliers and their application of industry knowledge. Assist in managing the contract portfolio for select categories, including contracting, compliance, and value / spend analysis. Closely partner with various internal cross-functional teams to ensure a close partnership with internal clients for delivering a consistent customer experience, while utilizing key sourcing, contracting and compliance processes. Lead and or support stakeholders on cost-saving initiatives that will require strong stakeholder management and the ability to inspire new ways of working across the business. Direct internal and external processes to ensure an integrated sourcing system that meets customer requirements, minimize total cost of ownership, maximize effectiveness including conforming to established quality standards that are responsive to the needs of the business and it’s customers. Develop business relationships with suppliers to preserve the company’s good business reputation while still obtaining competitive prices. Ensure optimal balance between value for money and cost savings is achieved, while ensuring quality and good customer service. Conduct market analyses for assigned categories to be used in the larger category strategies Utilize technology systems to enable real-time reporting and accurate data collection.
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply Chain, Finance or a related field is required. CPM or CPSM certification is preferred. 3 years + of progressively responsible experience in strategic sourcing and vendor management. Experience working with large scale cross functional teams. Experience managing multiple vendors.
Preferred Skills
Experience in creating and executing category strategies including cost reduction initiatives, vendor consolidation, and value creation initiatives. Experienced negotiator with a track record of creating SOWs, Purchase Agreements and value add contracts. Experience working with large scale Purchase to Pay and esourcing software tools. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal). Experience or willingness to learn new technologies and software that can drive efficiencies.
ABOUT THE TEAM Nielsen Media has been and will continue to be the most important third-party independent measurement provider. From development through syndication, the Product team provides critical data and insights that help inform measurement. You’ll be at the center of product development and delivery to enable media markets to function.
ABOUT NIELSEN
As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

Experience with Bayesian statisticsExperience with PyTorchFamiliarity with at least one of the cloud providers (e.g. AWS)Familiarity with the media and marketing industryExperience with a (quantitative) consultancy environment

item.title: Schedule Editor, deutsch
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
Gracenote Global Video Data ist die Datenbank für weltweite TV-, Film- und On-Demand-Daten. Marktführende TV-, OTT- und Serviceanbieter auf der ganzen Welt verlassen sich auf Gracenote, um das aktuelle TV-Programm akkurat wiedergeben zu können, das Suchen und Entdecken neuer Filme und Serien zu beschleunigen und Zuschauern die Möglichkeit zu geben, einfach ihre Lieblingssendungen zu finden und zu genießen. Mit umfassenden Daten zu Filmen und Serien, einschließlich Episoden- und Serienbeschreibungen, Genres, Moods und Details zur Besetzung, sowie Live Sportereignissen, Musik und mehr, unterstützt Gracenote Benutzeroberflächen und Discovery-Engines der nächsten Generation. Vom TV-Programm zum Touchdown - Gracenote ist der erste und einzige Anbieter, der umfassende Daten zu Filmen, Fernsehen, Sport und Musik sowie atemberaubende Bildern auf globaler Ebene liefert.
Wir suchen speziell für den deutschen/DACH Markt einen Schedule Editor mit guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen. Jede weitere europäische Sprachen ist ein Plus.
STELLENBESCHREIBUNG
Die Rolle des Schedule Editors ist eine Vollzeitstelle (Montag bis Freitag), die für die effiziente Verarbeitung und Einpflege von Daten des aktuellen TV-Programm verantwortlich ist. Die Position erfordert ein sorgfältiges Workflow- und Zeitmanagement, um das tägliche TV-Programm genau zu verarbeiten, zu aktualisieren und abzugleichen, sobald diesbezügliche Daten aktualisiert und von verschiedenen Anbietern verfügbar gemacht werden.
Schedule Editoren sind auch für die Aktualisierung und Verbesserung der Gracenote-Datenbank verantwortlich, die das Verbraucherprodukt und letztendlich das Nutzererlebnis unterstützt. Der/die ideale Kandidat/in ist in der Lage, eine große Menge an Metadaten zeitnah und präzise zu verarbeiten. Der/die Kandidat/in ist in der Lage, diese Daten zu bearbeiten, sie zu normalisieren und sie für die zeitlose Verwendung in der Gracenote-Datenbank anzureichern.

item.title: Sales Operations Manager
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
Location: US, Eastern Reports to: Sr Director Content Partnerships
Gracenote, a Nielsen company, is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world’s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path “big data.” Over the past 3 years, the company has grown to more than 2000 employees in 17 countries, including over 600 of the world’s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is one of America’s most iconic and respected media companies.
The Gracenote Global Content Partnerships team is responsible for recruiting and developing productive data provider partnerships with broadcasters, content owners and creators, rights holders, labels, technology providers and others in video, audio and sports verticals. The team engages with a growing base of over 50,000 partners that includes the largest global brands and important local niche players to obtain data sources and to optimize the quality and efficiency of that data.
The Sales Operations Manager is responsible for operationalizing Content Partnerships goals, objectives and plans, for developing tools, measures and tracking to ensure execution, and for collaborating with internal teams and external teams to identify, analyze, design, and implement improvements resulting in quality, scalability and speed gains. The role requires high degrees of skill in analysis, interpersonal, influencing, business case development, communication and presentation. Candidate must demonstrate a high level of self-awareness, self-motivation, organization, assertiveness, and ability to balance clear strategic vision, fact-driven analysis and relentless execution.
Responsibilities:
• Operationalize the goals and objectives of Content Partnerships, developing metrics, measures, analysis, allocation, project tracking and reporting to ensure execution of goals and visibility of progress and gaps. • Collaborate and coordinate with Transformation, Quality, Business Engagement and others to develop and implement tools, systems and processes that enable Content Partnerships execution, including scoping, user requirements and feedback gathering, specifications, implementation planning, risk and change management, documentation and training. • Generate reporting, dashboards and project plans to capture, analyze, and communicate functional operating metrics (e.g. partner pipelines, automation improvements, productivity, partner account planning, headcount and budget tracking, SLA adherence, onboarding, source quality). • Consolidate, refine, and manage capacity utilization model to improve management of priorities execution, FTE and budget planning, load balancing, task and resource allocation, and expectations management. • Drive rollout and broad adoption of Source Management System (SMS). Evangelize, capture and funnel system feedback, refine SMS through requirements gathering, prioritization and management.
Qualifications: • 5-7+ years’ experience in media, video, OTT/SVOD/MVPD, or related technology or service provider, with an understanding of the linear video and streaming ecosystem. • Demonstrated proficiency in one or more of business analysis, sales or partner operations, or project management. • Executive level communication, presentation and strong cross-functional collaboration skills. • Proficiency in Google workspace apps, including experience creating and using large databases and worksheets, pivot tables, charting, report and dashboard creation, presentations. • Proficiency with SFDC and / or ServiceNow. • BS/BA degree required. PMP certification and Yellow/Green belt are strong positives.reen belt are strong positives.

item.title: Research Field Interviewer-Boston MA
item.description:
Global Nielsen Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. At the core of our data is our Field & Call Center associates, who connect and build personal relationships with consumers to collect data on TV, Radio, and Digital Device consumption.
Research Field Interviewer -Boston, MA. Nielsen Media, a service of The Nielsen Company, tracks the television and media-viewing habits of homes across the country. Our data, which influences virtually every TV program in the U.S., shows not only what's being watched, but paints a rich portrait of the American Audience. As a pioneer and industry leader in audience measurement for more than half a century, we take pride in our technology and processes, and we are constantly searching for new ways to advance our legacy of innovation. Nielsen is offering an outstanding part-time opportunity. This position allows varied and non-traditional hours to include afternoons, evenings and weekends. Primary focus of this role is to visit homes to collect demographic and TV related information. Part-time Research Field Interviewers make personal visits to potential Nielsen families, without an appointment. Nielsen families will have their daily viewing gathered and reported in the Nielsen sample.
Census Enumerators are encouraged to apply.
We strongly encourage the referral of women and minorities for all open positions. EOE/M/F/D/V

This role has “work from home” flexibility. You must live within driving distance to the Dallas, TX location or Oldsmar FL location. While we are closed, this role will work from home 100%. Once the business fully re-opens, there may be a requirement to work in office a portion of the time.

The Panel Relations Specialist identifies ways to maintain/improve cooperation and quality of data gathered from Nielsen panelists. You will work with panelists reviewing performance data, fostering positive relations and coaching panelists on proper usage of proprietary equipment.
Role Details
Primary customer service contact, addressing household concerns, answering questions and ensuring long-term and accurate usage of equipment. Meets outbound and inbound call metrics. Builds solid, productive panelist relationships through positive communication. Collects and analyzes data, providing feedback to panelists. Collects and maintains demographic and device information via outbound and inbound calls to ensure quality of the data. Uses recruitment resources effectively and is able to present full disclosure of participation guidelines to panelists. Investigates and resolves proprietary system generated panelist performance issues. Schedules return calls as needed with panelists. Works with support departments as needed to resolve panelist issues.

In addition to a professional attitude, the successful candidate should also possess the following: Strong customer service and human relations skills Outbound and inbound call experience Problem solving, and performance analysis abilities Capable of working evenings and at least one weekend day each week English/Spanish bi-lingual language skills required Excellent organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines MS Office Suite experience (Word, Excel and Outlook) High School Diploma required, College degree or equivalent experience preferred

Description: Nielsen shapes the world’s media and content as a global leader in audience measurement, data and analytics. Through our understanding of people and their behaviors across all channels and platforms, we empower our clients with independent and actionable intelligence so they can connect and engage with their audiences—now and into the future. Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. item.title: Principal Data Scientist
item.description:
Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. Our team of researchers come from diverse disciplines and they drive innovation, new product ideation, experimental design and testing, complex analysis and delivery of data insights around the world. We support all International Media clients and are located where our clients are.
Team: Outcomes Cross Product R&D team
The Outcomes Cross Product R&D team is a newly formed team focused on building Nielsen Audience Outcomes' methodological connections with Audience Measurement. Audience Outcomes is our marketing effectiveness suite of products, which delivers the intelligence advertisers need to evaluate and optimize the impact of their marketing on their short-term and long-term goals. Audience Measurement provides cross-media measurement for advertisers, agencies, publishers, and ad platforms. Building a connection between these two product portfolios will require analyzing the current products, assessing underlying data assets, refining our methodologies to better align with measurement products, and developing shared metrics between media sellers and buyers. The overarching goal of this team is to enable Outcomes transactions’ data and analytics to seamlessly merge into Nielsen ONE.
Objectives of the role: Grow and lead a small team of data scientists who will be working on the development of the next generation of transactional marketing effectiveness metrics. Research and build the analytical and statistical models required to support those metrics. Partner with the technology teams to bring the whole system into production.
Responsibilities of the role: Work as part of an Agile cross-functional Scrum team to research, productionalize, validate, and optimize new methodologies and metrics. Work closely together with the Product Owner to help inform and translate product requirements into technical tasks for the data science team. Lead and participate in the development and maintenance of a production-level codebase, assessing the value of new technologies for current or future applications. Summarize, document, and communicate research findings to audiences of varying levels of technical subject matter expertise. Provide support for technical guidance and training of other team members. Manage more junior data scientists on the team.
Skills and Qualifications: 5+ years of professional work experience in Statistics, Data Science, and/or related disciplines. Master’s degree in a quantitative research field, such as data science, statistics, mathematics, social sciences, biological/physical sciences, computer science, etc, or equivalent work experience. Solid understanding of statistics and probability theory with real-world experience applying that knowledge in analytical problem-solving. Several years of programming experience in Python. Expertise with data analysis tools and libraries, such as NumPy / SciPy / scikit-learn / pandas / matplotlib, etc. Experience with cloud environments and big data technologies (e.g., Spark, AWS) Collaborative code development experience, including version control, unit/integration testing, code review, and sharing. Experience in managing and executing large-scale, complex technical projects Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Additional advantageous knowledge and experience:
*Knowledge of Bayesian inference and probabilistic programming. *Knowledge of workflow management tools such as Airflow, Luigi, etc. *Experience working in an Agile cross-functional development team. *Experience managing direct reports. *Experience in marketing/media, including domain expertise in any of the following areas: *Marketing effectiveness measurement (e.g. MTA, Marketing Mix Modeling, Sales Lift measurement) *Audience measurement and Targeting (e.g. reach and frequency measurement, audience segmentation, programmatic activation) *Digital / Cross-Platform advertiser and activation (e.g. orchestrating digital ad buys, executing digital / cross-platform campaigns, digital ad operations) *Strategic and tactical media planning (e.g. budget allocation, building cross-platform or channel-specific media plans) *Technical knowledge of cross-platform media/behavior measurement technologies and data, including any of the following: *Media panels *Ad serving technology (e.g. JS / pixel tags; data management platforms) “Big data” media measurement sources (e.g. set-top box, Smart TV data) *Data matching methods (e.g. cross-device data; online-to-offline, onboarding; PII matching and management) *Secure computing environments (e.g. clean rooms, Ads Data Hub, etc.)

item.title: Modelling Analyst
item.description:
Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. Our team of researchers come from diverse disciplines and they drive innovation, new product ideation, experimental design and testing, complex analysis and delivery of data insights around the world. We support all International Media clients and are located where our clients are.
Nielsen Marketing Effectiveness uses cutting-edge technology and industry-leading data science to tackle some of the hardest problems in marketing science. Our goal is to provide reaction measurements at unprecedented speed and scale.

Our goal is to provide reaction measurement at unprecedented speed and scale.

item.title: Media Operations Officer
item.description:
Global Nielsen Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. At the core of our data is our Field & Call Center associates, who connect and build personal relationships with consumers to collect data on TV, Radio, and Digital Device consumption.
ABOUT THE ROLE
To understand the behaviour of the populations in Thailand regarding the media landscape, then a single-source multi-media survey provides critical insights into the media and buying habits is required. The Consumer Media View (CMV) fuses survey data capturing a single source read of individuals’ claimed product and media consumption and lifestyle/ attitudes with actual media rating data.
And to understand the behaviour of the populations in Thailand regarding the radio station listening for the Greater Bangkok area, then a single source survey provides listening insights is required. RAM (Radio Audience Measurement) survey data capturing a radio listening of individuals’ claimed radio listening consumption with actual media rating data.
The primary objective is to operate the data validation on a daily basis and be able to monitor the survey projects with data summarized as required. To learn and understand how to create and manage the internal survey platform tool and also perform an update/analyze follow the requirements of each project.

และเพื่อทำความเข้าใจพฤติกรรมของประชากรในประเทศไทยเกี่ยวกับการฟังคลื่นวิทยุในเขตกรุงเทพและปริมณฑล การออกแบบสำรวจโดยใช้แหล่งข้อมูลเดียว สำหรับข้อมูลการฟังวิทยุจึงเป็นสิ่งจำเป็นเช่นเดียวกัน RAM (Radio Audience Measurement) คือข้อมูลการสำรวจการฟังวิทยุที่อ้างอิงข้อมูลการฟังของแต่ละบุคคลและรายงานเป็น เรตติ้ง จากข้อมูลจริงเช่นเดียวกัน
วัตถุประสงค์หลักของงานในตำแน่งนี้ คือการดำเนินการตรวจสอบข้อมูลเป็นประจำทุกวัน และสามารถตรวจสอบข้อมูลความถูกต้องของแบบสำรวจด้วยข้อมูลสรุปตามที่ต้องการได้. สามารถเรียนรู้และทำความเข้าใจวิธีสร้าง รวมไปถึงจัดการเครื่องมือแพลตฟอร์มการทำแบบสำรวจของภายในองค์กร และยังทำการอัพเดท/วิเคราะห์ตามความต้องการของแต่ละงานที่รับผิดชอบได้

Does consultative selling across a portfolio of over 20 different solutions excite you? If you are a passionate salesperson, with experience in sales and account management, data and analytics, media, measurement or research/insight services, and love the thrill of chasing a new sale as much as building great client relationships - this role is for you!

item.description:

At Nielsen, we are obsessed with bringing transparency and truth to the media industry. Through rapid innovation on our technology and data, we’re determined to be leaders and visionaries in how the industry evolves. You are comfortable balancing the “right now” of sales teams and the vision of product teams. You are not only someone who is willing to roll up your sleeves to get the job done, but also thinks critically about the “why” behind actions and how it contributes to the broader goals of the company.

Job Responsibilities The scope of the Manager, Client Solutions function ranges from in-bound calls/emails and addressing linear and digital ratings and advertising data inquiries, understanding consumer viewership behaviors across screens, and maintaining knowledge of Nielsen’s Total Audience and Nielsen ONE products. The Manager, Client Solutions will be both client-facing and have the ability to develop strong internal partnerships to deepen his/her understanding of Nielsen’s full suite of products and capabilities. The Manager, Client Solutions will take ownership over a significant portion of managing both the client relationship and internal/external projects and relationships in support of client networks.

Core Capabilities ⦁ The ideal candidate should be prepared to act as a teammate within Nielsen’s National Media organization with a willingness to share ideas, learn, and collaborate as is part of the Nielsen culture. ⦁ The ideal candidate will possess robust written and oral communication skills, an ability to adapt to the needs of our dynamic environment, and a strong response orientation. ⦁ He or she will have an intellectual curiosity and passion for data, the ability to build and hone key relationships both internally and externally, and an enthusiasm for media, research and the entertainment industry. ⦁ The ideal candidate will have a passion for meeting new people and creating lasting relationships. ⦁ The ability to work with a team to drive toward a shared revenue growth target.
Additional Skills / Experience Required ⦁ 3-5 years of professional experience in client or customer management ⦁ Bachelors Degree in related field preferred ⦁ Background in media, preferably from a media agency, media company, or media measurement company ⦁ Experience with linear and digital media planning & buying preferred ⦁ Strong interpersonal and problem solving skills ⦁ Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively and build a strong network ⦁ Critical thinking skills to analyze and resolve complex problems ⦁ Acts proactively and manages multiple priorities ⦁ Experience with Salesforce a plus ⦁ Experience with Google Workspace a plus

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer - Remote
item.description:
Nielsen Media would not function without our Technology teams! We are catalysts for delivery quality, on-time, reliable measurements to clients, and we are cultivators, growing our employees through education, skill building and experiences. Around the globe, our Technology teams are relentless in our pursuit of superior analytics, technology, process and support.
The Machine Learning Engineer will work on new technology and research projects within the content recognition and classification area of Nielsen. You will be working to identify and/or classify content from both audio and video. In order to make these technologies, you should have a good theoretical background and practical experience with machine learning systems. Theoretical knowledge about audio or video is required, and you should be capable of performing signal processing on either audio or video data. We expect you to be well versed in engineering best practices and software design concepts, and to be able to document and explain your work. You will coordinate your work with the tasks of colleagues from your own team and other Nielsen teams. You will interact with Nielsen customers and partners as required while developing the next content recognition or classification product. As time allows, you will advise and lead other engineering colleagues and student interns. You could also initiate or participate in the publication of scientific papers, and represent Nielsen at scientific conferences.

item.title: Live Scorer Sports (Bijbaan)
item.description:
Live Scorer Sports (Bijbaan) - 111263 Operations - Netherlands Nieuwegein, Utrecht
Live Scorer Sports (bijbaan)
Gracenote is op zoek naar sportliefhebbers die live gegevens van (inter)nationale sportwedstrijden en evenementen gaan bijhouden. Dit vindt voornamelijk plaats in het weekend. Daarnaast kun je aan de slag op doordeweekse avonden en is daarom ideaal te combineren naast een studie! Remote werken is mogelijk.
ENKELE VOORBEELDEN VAN WERKZAAMHEDEN: Registreren van live data van voetbalwedstrijden over de hele wereld: doelpunten, opstellingen, kaarten en wissels. De Europa League, de Engelse Football League (2e niveau) en de Portugese Primeira Liga, het is een kleine selectie van de circa 250 voetbalcompetities waar je mee te maken krijgt. Live bijhouden van de Nederlandse Keuken Kampioen Divisie en de Tweede Divisie met behulp van ons correspondentennetwerk waar je via de telefoon mee in contact staat. Live bijhouden van ijshockey, basketbal, Formule 1, rugby, wielrennen en nog vele andere sporten!
WAT IS ER VOOR DE FUNCTIE VEREIST? Je bent veel beschikbaar in de weekenden tussen augustus en mei: je bent minimaal op zaterdag of zondag de hele dag inzetbaar. Beschikbaar zijn op doordeweekse avonden is een pré. Snel en nauwkeurig te werk kunnen gaan en goed kunnen multitasken. Je bent 18 jaar of ouder. Snel kunnen werken met computers, een scherpe blik en uitstekende sportkennis. Je hebt thuis een goede werkplek met 2 schermen en een stabiele internetverbinding.
Bij goed functioneren kom je in aanmerking om meer werkzaamheden te leren, zoals het bijhouden van topvoetbal (o.a. Bundesliga en Premier League). Ook is het mogelijk om op termijn in aanmerking te komen voor diensten met meer verantwoordelijkheid, waarbij je helpt met de kwaliteitscontrole of het begeleiden van een gedeelte van de live scoring.
Interesse? Stuur een korte e-mail naar gn.livecoordination@nielsen.com; gebruik de naam van de functie als onderwerp van je mail. Wij nemen dan snel contact met je op!
Job Type: Regular Primary Location:Nieuwegein,Utrecht Travel: No

Position: Part Time Sports Data Entry Operator Shift: Evenings & Full Weekends. Wage: $13.35 per hour
Gracenote - Canada Halifax, Nova Scotia
Calling all sports fans! If you have a passion for sports, enjoy working with data, and want to get paid for watching what you love, this is the position for you! Nielsen is expanding our team and looking for part-time Sports Data Entry Operators. We are searching for a highly motivated and knowledgeable sports gurus, specializing in American Football, Basketball, Hockey, and Baseball. This is a seasonal position up on hiring that runs from August into the spring but has the potential for extending to a year-round position.
As a Sports Data Entry Operator, you will watch live sporting events primarily for North American professional sports and enter sports statistics and information into our custom software. item.title: International Media Analytics Research Manager (UK/Remote)
item.description:
AUDIENCE IS EVERYTHING™ Operating in over 100 countries, Nielsen is the market leader when it comes to measurement, information and insights within the Media industry. Being the trusted partner to many advertisers, agencies and media owners - we pride ourselves on integrity, accuracy and quality to ensure our clients are making informed decisions to optimise their growth.
About the job: The Nielsen Media Analytics team is an innovation hub. It is tasked with answering client questions in new and innovative ways, creating new products and services that address industry gaps. Our goal is to keep Nielsen Media at the cutting edge of measurement. The Research team forms an integral part of this team; owning and guiding others in our narrative and storytelling frameworks. We work with the biggest names in the media industry and are looking for someone who is curious and has a good understanding of research methodologies.
About You: This is an exciting opportunity for a talented, passionate Research Manager to thrive in a unique environment. Working to support teams across 25+ markets, the Research Manager will help guide the path of the international Media Analytics business at a local, regional and international level.
The Media Analytics function has several overarching products which are available in many countries. At the same time, individual markets also have their own particular client questions to address. This means that our Research Manager must be able to straddle both and be able to see the bigger picture and the detail.
Other key characteristics which will be core to success in this role include the ability to be an intelligent yet quick thinker. Working with Nielsen and 3rd party data requires critical analysis but also a lot of common sense! This requires curiosity, not just about methodologies and data, but also into the global marketing landscape including local, often singular, nuances.
The research manager should be a keen observer of the phenomena which they will then need to analyse and interpret. Not only this but, key to this role will be the ability to teach and mentor others to do the same. This requires a people person, a patient, sympathetic colleague with the wish to help others to thrive.
To be successful in the role, the research manager must be organised, collaborative, keen to learn and always act with integrity. They must also always be willing to teach others to be the same.

item.description:

German Editor - 109651
ABOUT THE ROLE Gracenote is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world’s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path “big data.” Over the past 3 years, the company has grown to more than 2000 employees in 17 countries, including over 600 of the world’s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is one of America’s most iconic and respected media companies.
We are currently looking for a German Editor.
ROLE: Our TV and movie Editor performs editorial functions related to the ongoing development and creation of media databases and content, specifically in the audiovisual sphere. The ideal candidate loves movies and series, is familiar and up to date with TV listings and the media sector in general. This person will be responsible for performing high-volume, complex manipulations on the entertainment information that forms the core of Gracenote’s media database, with special focus on creating and enhancing Top Content (Top Series, Top Movies, Keywords etc.).
RESPONSIBILITIES Acquire and record correct information regarding programs and TV listings from a variety of German channels and top content providers. Investigate, confirm and document questionable program content by consulting program information providers and others. Consolidate data content and new program information in databases. Edit and maintain TV listings information, create and curate information on movies and shows. Maintain accurate database information and provide timely updating of listings information. Ensure the accuracy of editorial content, authenticity of program information and timely delivery to in-house personnel. Analyze, develop and recommend solutions to editorial, communication and technical procedural and operational needs. Act as a customer service representative concerning product content and editorial policies. Other duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS Must be native or near-native German and have IMPECCABLE writing and verbal skills. The ability to commence asap is highly desirable. Effective writing, grammatical, organizational, analytical, and communication skills. Preferably with a background in journalism, copy writing or translation. Good knowledge of German television and VOD programming preferred, and most importantly a love for movies. We are looking for a quality focused individual with a high level of attention to detail. Must be able to work accurately under deadline and willing to work outside regular business hours. Windows proficiency and/or experience using other computer software and databases with excellent keyboarding skills. Excellent Keyboarding skills expected.
ABOUT NIELSEN As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth. Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Gracenote, a Nielsen company, provides music, video, and sports content along with technologies to the world's hottest entertainment products and brands. Gracenote is the global standard for music and video recognition which is supported by the largest source of entertainment data. Gracenote features descriptions of more than 200 million tracks, TV listings for 85+ countries and statistics from 4,500 sport leagues and competitions.

Football Stats Operator (Bijbaan)
Voor versterking van ons sportsteam is Gracenote op zoek naar Football Stats Operators voor het registreren van uitgebreide data tijdens live voetbalwedstrijden. Met behulp van een geavanceerd invoersysteem worden onder andere alle doelpunten en schoten bekeken en ingevoerd in onze database. Dit gebeurt live tijdens de wedstrijd aan de hand van tv-beelden. Samen met een collega werk je zo snel mogelijk om deze diepe voetbaldata te leveren aan onze (media)klanten.
Heb jij verstand van voetbal en kun je snel werken met computers? Dit is dan de bijbaan voor jou! Vanwege de werktijden in het weekend en in de avonduren ook ideaal te combineren met studie. Remote werken is mogelijk.
ENKELE VOORBEELDEN VAN WERKZAAMHEDEN: Invoeren van o.a. doelpunten en schoten in wedstrijden uit competities zoals: Bundesliga, Premier League, Serie A, Ligue 1, La Liga en Eredivisie. Invoeren van kaarten, wissels, corners, buitenspel, overtredingen enzovoort.
WANNEER WERK JE? Tijdens het voetbalseizoen (eind augustus t/m eind mei) werk je bijna elke zaterdag of zondag als er gespeeld wordt in de grote Europese voetbalcompetities. De precieze werktijden op een dag zijn afhankelijk van het voetbalprogramma. Op zaterdag en zondag liggen je werktijden ergens tussen begin van de middag en laat in de avond. Tijdens een weekenddienst analyseer je meestal twee wedstrijden. Op doordeweekse avonden analyseer je meestal één wedstrijd.
WAT IS ER VOOR DE FUNCTIE VEREIST? Je bent 18 jaar of ouder (er is beperkt plek als je jonger bent dan 18 jaar). Minimaal 1 dag in het weekend beschikbaar. Beschikbaar zijn op doordeweekse avonden is een pré. Snel kunnen werken met computers, een scherpe blik en uitstekende voetbalkennis. Je hebt thuis een goede werkplek met 2 schermen en een stabiele internetverbinding.
Bij goed functioneren kom je in aanmerking om meer werkzaamheden te leren, zoals het bijhouden van andere sporten (o.a. Formule 1). Ook is het mogelijk om op termijn in aanmerking te komen voor diensten met meer verantwoordelijkheid, waarbij je helpt met de kwaliteitscontrole of het begeleiden van een gedeelte van de live scoring.
Interesse? Stuur een korte e-mail naar gn.livecoordination@nielsen.com; gebruik de naam van de functie als onderwerp van je mail. Wij nemen dan snel contact met je op! Job Type: Regular Primary Location:Nieuwegein,Utrecht Travel: No
