item.title: Editor(English)
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
ABOUT THE ROLE
This role is responsible for our online video metadata, a key part of the Gracenote video data ingestion platform, consuming data from the digital catalogs of media outlets like Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, and iTunes and preparing that data for curation by Gracenote's editorial teams. Expect to spend about creating, curate and enhancing metadata: both for currently airing TV programs, as well as maintaining a permanent library of TV program data. Proactively research information for TV and Movies assets. Initiate, track and maintain communication with broadcasters, and relevant content providers to achieve results.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Read and understand plots and write the synopsis in English Write synopsis in different character lengths/counts Research and rephrase content to avoid plagiarism Adapt to the in-house style and replicate it in the writing Perform factual checks, using standard reference sources Put in extra hours during crunched timelines and work under tight deadlines Ensure timely delivery of accurate and reliable information
QUALIFICATION
Must be a graduate in any field Should be proficient in the English language and possess excellent writing and communication skills
BONUS QUALIFICATIONS:
Knowledge or interest in television, films and SEO is an added advantage Excellent research skills
ABOUT THE TEAM
This role is with the Editorial team at Gracenote, which is a part of a Nielsen Company. The team is responsible for translating English metadata into different Indian regional languages. Gracenote is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
ABOUT NIELSEN
We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.
We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what’s next with us at Nielsen: www.nielsen.com & www.gracenote.com.

item.title: Editor, German (Remote)
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
POSITION: Editor, Germany REPORTS TO: Team Lead WORK LOCATION: Anywhere in Germany
Gracenote is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world’s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path “big data.” Over the past 3 years, the company has grown to more than 2000 employees in 17 countries, including over 600 of the world’s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is one of America’s most iconic and respected media companies.
We are currently looking for an Editor, German language.
ROLE:
Our TV and movie Editor performs editorial functions related to the ongoing development and creation of media databases and content, specifically in the audiovisual sphere. The ideal candidate loves movies and series, is familiar and up to date with TV listings and the media sector in general. This person will be responsible for performing high-volume, complex manipulations on the entertainment information that forms the core of Gracenote’s media database, with special focus on creating and enhancing Top Content (Top Series, Top Movies, Keywords etc.).
RESPONSIBILITIES
● Acquire and record correct information regarding programs and TV listings from a variety of German channels and top content providers. ● Investigate, confirm and document questionable program content by consulting program information providers and others. ● Consolidate data content and new program information in databases. ● Edit and maintain TV listings information, create and curate information on movies and shows. ● Maintain accurate database information and provide timely updating of listings information. ● Ensure the accuracy of editorial content, authenticity of program information and timely delivery to in-house personnel. ● Analyze, develop and recommend solutions to editorial, communication and technical procedural and operational needs. ● Act as a customer service representative concerning product content and editorial policies. ● Other duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS
● Must be native or near-native German and have IMPECCABLE writing and verbal skills. The ability to commence asap is highly desirable. ● Effective writing, grammatical, organizational, analytical, and communication skills. ● Preferably with a background in journalism, copy writing or translation. ● Good knowledge of German television and VOD programming preferred, and most importantly a love for movies. ● We are looking for a quality focused individual with a high level of attention to detail. ● Must be able to work accurately under deadline and willing to work outside regular business hours. ● Windows proficiency and/or experience using other computer software and databases with excellent keyboarding skills. ● Excellent Keyboarding skills expected.
Our passion for music, TV and sports is at the heart of everything we do. But what really makes us tick is our people. From Emeryville to Tokyo and Queensbury to Copenhagen, we are building the team that’s going to disrupt the digital universe. This starts by creating a workplace where all things entertainment are celebrated and innovation can come from anyone. If you are interested in being mission critical and on the leading edge of global entertainment technology then please contact us today!
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
#LI-NT1

ABOUT THE ROLE The Nielsen Marketing Effectiveness (MEFF) team plays a pivotal role in helping clients ensure every $ they spend works for them and returns. We do this by providing a mix of data-led models, software solutions and consultancy to ensure clients get the results they need. We answer their key business questions to improve marketing performance, questions like What ROI does my marketing generate? How can I improve my marketing? How should I optimize my marketing investment?
At Nielsen, we leverage the power of multiple modelling methodologies without compromising the accuracy or actionability of the insights produced, so clients have access to the right insights, at exactly the right time to support any marketing decision. From strategic investments across all channels to daily tactical optimizations while campaigns are still in-flight, our holistic Marketing Effectiveness solutions deliver the unmatched speed, data access, and comprehensive measurement your team needs to keep pace with consumers, minimize waste and drive revenue and business growth. As the Director of Marketing Effectiveness SEA, you will focus on creating and closing opportunities with new logos & expanding existing relationships across SEA. You will be at the forefront of driving the development of a highly diverse and inclusive company culture and collaborate effectively with other Nielsen business units in the region to identify innovation and commercial growth opportunities. Click here to learn more about Marketing Effectiveness (MEFF).
ROLE DETAILS As a Director – Marketing Effectiveness SEA, you will be the key player to drive success across SEA and as a senior sales professional with a very strong understanding of Marketing ROI, significant enterprise solution sales experience and a deep understanding of digital advertising ecosystem. You will be responsible for generating new business relationships and developing existing business within a designated territory. It requires an ability to understand and articulate the value of Nielsen’s marketing effectiveness solutions to customers and partners up to the C-level. The focus of this role is on selling Nielsen Marketing effectiveness solutions to new clients and increasing penetration of our solutions with existing clients. This will be across all verticals and all Nielsen Marketing Effectiveness products (including Marketing Mix Modeling, Multi-Touch Attribution and Lift). You will be responsible for generating new business relationships and developing existing business within a designated territory. It requires an ability to understand and articulate the value of Nielsen’s marketing effectiveness solutions to customers and partners up to the C-level. Building a territory plan to meet sales targets. Exceeding quarterly / annual sales targets by prospecting and closing new business as well as cultivating existing client relationships to sign deals with new brands Complex sales-cycle management; manage the entire sales process engaging the appropriate resources such as Solution Consultants, Client Services, Executives and Partners. Ensuring delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts. Creating and maintaining a sales pipeline in Salesforce.com to ensure over-achievement. Partnering closely with the Customer Success and Operations teams to manage revenue and ensure delivery matches the sales promise. Partnering closely with the Nielsen Media organization in SEA to ensure we leverage the full scale of Nielsen. Engaging and developing relationships with C-level executives, positioning Nielsen solutions through strategic value-based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data. Generating short-term results whilst maintaining a long-term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. Accurate quarterly forecasting and revenue delivery. QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS 10+ years of relevant experience in digital advertising and/or enterprise SaaS technology and Marketing ROI solutions An in-depth understanding of the marketing effectiveness measurement space Strong successful sales track record in meeting or exceeding assigned individual quota greater than $1.0MM History of closing 6-figure deals Excellent oral and written communication skills including strong presentation skills Strong understanding of solution/consultative selling Self-starter who can develop sales leads as well as build strong rapports with partners A passion for sales and a passion for delighting clients ABOUT THE TEAM You will be working as part of an APAC wide Marketing Effectiveness team but will have responsibility for new business revenue generation across SEA. This is an individual contributor role that will require the successful candidate to be based in Singapore but undertake travel across the region (post-COVID restrictions)

item.title: DE & I Editor
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
POSITION: DE & I Editor DEPARTMENT: Editorial REPORTS TO: Team Lead, Manager
Gracenote is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world’s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path “big data.” Over the past 3 years, the company has grown to more than 2000 employees in 17 countries, including over 600 of the world’s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is one of America’s most iconic and respected media companies. We are currently looking for an Editor to support our Diversity and Inclusion Data Sets
ROLE:
Our Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) Editor performs editorial functions related to the ongoing development and creation of media databases and content, specifically in the audiovisual sphere. The ideal candidate loves entertainment data, with a focus on diversity and inclusion and is passionate about celebrity data, is familiar and up to date with TV/Film programming and the media sector in general. This person will be responsible for performing high-volume, complex manipulations on the entertainment information that forms the core of Gracenote’s media database, with special focus on creating and enhancing data associated with Diversity and Inclusion across Top Content (Top Series, Top Movies, Keywords etc.).
RESPONSIBILITIES
• Acquire and record correct information regarding D & I data from a variety of sources including but not limited to studios, distributors and press releases. • Edit and maintain diversity data, create and curate information on celebrity, production companies, movies and shows. • Investigate, confirm and document questionable content by consulting industry associations, researched information providers and internal teams. • Consolidate data content and information in databases. • Maintain accurate database information and provide timely updating of programming information. • Develop and recommend solutions to editorial, communication and technical procedural and operational needs • Act as a customer service representative concerning product content and editorial policies. • Other duties as assigned.
REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS

item.title: Data Specialist
item.description:
As a product-led organization, Global Nielsen Media puts the product at the center of the strategy and brings cross-functional teams together to work on particular products. With over 2,800 global patents in over 80 countries, the Product team drives value with cutting-edge solutions and analytics to create insights. Be a part of creating the innovative solutions that define the media ecosystem playing field and enable media markets to function
At Nielsen, division Media Planning, we develop creative analytical solutions to support companies in the optimization of their marketing and communications budgets. Analytical and econometric approaches form the backbone of these solutions, answering questions like "What media mix works best to communicate my brand message?”, “What budget should I invest in media and marketing?". Our software tools and other decision-support solutions combine market research, data, modeling results and technical business intelligence.
ABOUT THE JOB
In this position, you contribute to the successful implementation of our software solutions for advertisers, media owners and media agencies. Our solutions help these companies in making decisions around their marketing communication budgets. Based upon research data combined with analytical and econometric approaches our solutions answer questions like "What budget is needed to generate an increase of 10% in brand preference? What media mix contributes the most to the revenue?" You will be working in (small) teams on preparing the market research data for use in our software, and grow to be the specialist within the team. This involves data checking, data processing, using automation in Python, data storage and version management. We expect you to have a keen eye to automate and improve processes. In your role, you will act as the data processor for many different projects, with different kinds of data from all over the world, which can be from our own research or from external sources.

item.title: Data Scientist (Remote)
item.description:
Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. We support all International Media clients and are located where our clients are.
Title: Data Scientist - (Remote) Division: Data Science
Where will I be? We are a growing workforce integrated throughout the US and Internationally, though this particular role will be based in the United States. Working hours? We encourage working similar hours as the rest of your team to ensure overlap needed for collaboration, though are flexible based on individual needs. Can I work remotely? Of course! While many associates are located near Nielsen offices in New York, Chicago and Tampa, we leverage collaboration tools like Google Meet and Slack that enable us to work remotely.
What is the role? We are looking to add a Data Scientist to our team of innovative Panel and Meter researchers. You will learn and become an expert in Nielsen’s TV panel data, with a focus on Meter hardware and software used for data collection and crediting. You will also have opportunities to present research to key stakeholders and collect/implement feedback as necessary, and partner with cross-functional stakeholders to deploy their recommended methodologies into production systems. Excited? Come join us!

Data Mapping Editors are also responsible for maintaining, updating and improving the Gracenote database that powers the consumer product and ultimately the end-user experience. Processing and manipulation of data required to ingest correctly into in-house soft-ware tools. High attention to detail required to ensure that high-quality, accurate and timely, evergreen content is created in the Gracenote database. Investigate, query and confirm questionable programming content when applicable. Run quality and assurance checks via systematic reports looking at the live database. Analyze and recommend process improvements. Contribute to team and department projects as assigned. Other duties as assigned.

Top cable, satellite, OTT and service providers around the world rely on Gracenote to power TV schedules, turbo charge video search and discovery, and empower audiences to find and enjoy their favourite shows. With deep data describing movies and TV shows, including episode and series descriptions, genres, moods, and cast details, as well as live sports events, music and more, Gracenote powers next-generation user interfaces and discovery engines. From TV listings to touchdowns, Gracenote is the first and only provider of descriptive data for Movies, TV, Sports and Music, as well as stunning imagery on a global scale.
We are looking for a Data Mapping Editor for the French market specifically with French language skills.
ROLE:
The role of Data Mapping Editor is a full-time, Monday to Friday position, responsible for the efficient processing and curation of video catalogs (VOD/OVD). It requires diligent workflow management to accurately process, update and match VOD/OVD catalogs as they update and/or become available by different content providers. Data Mapping Editors are also responsible for maintaining, updating and improving the Gracenote database that powers the consumer product and ultimately the end-user experience. Data Mapping Editors assist and report directly to Ingest Metadata Production Team Leaders, who manage all market- specific daily operations. The ideal candidate will be able to accurately process a high volume of entertainment metadata in a timely fashion. They will be able to manipulate this data, to normalize and enhance it for evergreen use in the Gracenote database.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Acquire, normalize and enhance entertainment metadata (OVD/VOD catalogs) from various content providers. Processing and manipulation of data required to ingest correctly into in-house soft-ware tools. High attention to detail required to ensure that high-quality, accurate and timely, evergreen content is created in the Gracenote database. Investigate, query and confirm questionable programming content when applicable. Run quality and assurance checks via systematic reports looking at the live database. Analyze and recommend process improvements. Contribute to team and department projects as assigned. Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
Proficient knowledge of the French language (B2 level or higher). Experience using computer software and databases, very good keyboarding skills. Data entry experience using content management systems beneficial. Experience with, or desire to work within a team, excellent communication skills. Must be able to work accurately under deadline. Good knowledge of television, movies and VOD programming is a plus, especially in the market language.
ABOUT THE TEAM
The powerful combination of Nielsen and Gracenote brings together world-class entertainment metadata that helps millions of people find, discover and tune-in to entertainment they love with Nielsen’s audience measurement expertise about what people are actually watching, listening to and buying.

As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. This person needs to not only being an experienced incident responder but also participate in the growth and improvement of their program. The Cybersecurity Incident Response Manager at Nielsen is one of three direct reports to the VP, Threat Management. They are part of the SOC, and are responsible for managing the incident response team including providing oversight to incident response activities (triage, root cause analysis, escalation, communication etc.

item.title: Chief Methodologist
item.description:
Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. Our team of researchers come from diverse disciplines and they drive innovation, new product ideation, experimental design and testing, complex analysis and delivery of data insights around the world. We support all International Media clients and are located where our clients are.
Chief Methodologist
We are changing the future of cross-platform measurement. Our platform, Nielsen ONE, will provide reach and frequency metrics across linear programming, streaming, connected TV (CTV), and digital channels. It will enable buyers and sellers to use a single currency that is trusted, independent, and standardized across the industry. This evolution of measurement requires redesigning Nielsen’s current panel-first methodologies and processes and updating core techniques and models to integrate big data in the measurement - while maintaining the standards and quality that is defensible in the marketplace. We have created a new role of Chief Methodologist to accelerate the transition.
In this role, the Chief Methodologist is responsible for leading Nielsen's core Audience Measurement methodologies, supporting Nielsen One. Reporting to the Chief Data & Research Officer, the methodologist will own all methodology decisions. The methodologist will collaborate and influence Data Science leadership and their respective teams and- for the methods-first initiatives - will be responsible for leading and delivering programs.

item.title: Big Data Developer_Mumbai/Bangalore
item.description:
Nielsen Media would not function without our Technology teams! We are catalysts for delivery quality, on-time, reliable measurements to clients, and we are cultivators, growing our employees through education, skill building and experiences. Around the globe, our Technology teams are relentless in our pursuit of superior analytics, technology, process and support.
About the Role
The responsibilities of this position includes working closely with the Scrum team to build and enhance new features & the various teams that work with the Client Success organization to ensure consistent delivery of functionality & support the platform. The individual will take bottom line responsibility of the functional module(s) that he/she is directly responsible for & ensure consistency in deliveries.
Role Details
SOLUTIONING ○ Works with the Product Owner to understand, refine & find the right solution to a business use case. Defines technical use cases corresponding to business requirements that are comprehensive from a functional and non-functional perspective. ○ Implements the solution adhering to the processes & methodologies followed in the team that includes adherence to design principles, unit test coverage, performance considerations, release process, post go live support model.
EXECUTION ○ Demonstrates excellent problem solving skills to find scalable & robust solutions to functional/technical problems ○ Works very closely with the testing team to make the functional modules ready for deployment & release ○ Proactively identifies & resolves functional and non-functional limitations
COLLABORATION ○ Demonstrates excellent collaboration to work effectively with the team & other partners in the ecosystem that includes Product, Program, QA, <any other> ○ Demonstrates a “Team First” attitude & works collaboratively to achieve common goals
OWNERSHIP ○ Demonstrates absolute bottom line for the modules that the associate owns.
CONTINUOUS LEARNING ○ Demonstrates inquisitiveness to adapt to new technologies & learn the domain and better ways to bring out solutions that best fit the functional and nonfunctional requirements.

item.title: Backend Team Leader
item.description:
Nielsen Media would not function without our Technology teams! We are catalysts for delivery quality, on-time, reliable measurements to clients, and we are cultivators, growing our employees through education, skill building and experiences. The backend team is at the forefront of technology, using new technologies and going forward all the time. Our current stack includes NodeJS, AWS services, K8S, RethinkDB, Elasticsearch, and many more. Working on a micro-services, micro-frontends architecture with development teams all over the world, develop and maintain a shared backend platform for multiple apps Charged with finding, examining, and introducing new technologies to the rest of the company. In our group, there is a strong emphasis on high-scale, quality (Clean code, best practices, design, and architecture, test coverage, CI/CD) and on continuous learning (empowerment programs, lunch and learn, technical forums, meetup hostings). We have very strong people in our group who are passionate about technology and push to be up to date with the latest technologies and paradigms. We also use and contribute to open-source projects. Here at Nielsen, you can enjoy startup spirit with the benefits of a big company. Our organization prides itself on being a place where employees can be themselves, make a difference, and grow their careers within the company (Both local and at the global level). By joining us, we can guarantee you'll have the opportunity to partner with great and professional people and be part of a company that embraces flexibility and freedom

item.title: Audit Associate, Leadership Development Program (Remote)
item.description:
As guardians of the Nielsen Media assets, our Finance teams strive to accurately report the financial position of Nielsen. We seek to continuously improve finance processes, controls and systems. We aim to provide clear, simple and insightful financial information to our business leaders in order to drive positive financial action. As a team we work in the spirit of integrity, accountability, quality and diligence, whilst maintaining the highest ethical standard
OVERVIEW Nielsen’s Corporate Audit Staff (CAS) is a fast-paced, dynamic, and highly-selective team. CAS serves not only as an independent internal audit function, but also as a leadership development program (not a traditional audit shop) . CAS provides objective assurance over Nielsen’s reported financials and has reporting accountability to Nielsen’s management team, Audit Committee, and External Audit partner. As Nielsen is a global enterprise, CAS has audit responsibilities over 70+ countries. In addition to audit work, CAS engages in projects that support process improvement and critical strategic initiatives to support Nielsen.
RESPONSIBILITIES ● Evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls by performing IT SOX and Finance audits. This includes planning, scoping, testing, and drafting audit reports. ● Identify control deficiencies, inconsistencies, and/or incidents of fraud or misconduct. ● Present findings/recommendations to senior leaders. Partner with the business to develop remediation plans and support best practice sharing. ● Be involved in non-standard audit engagements around upcoming risk areas like privacy, cyber security and ESG. ● Provide independent assurance on business compliance with policy, governance, and internal controls. ● Contribute to the development of audit process improvements and efficiency, including the development of automated routines. ● Work on high impact projects related to process improvement, analytics, financial reporting, etc. and present results to senior leaders. ● Domestic and international travel is required (30-50%) pending COVID-19 precautions.
QUALIFICATIONS/ KEY SKILL SETS ● Bachelor's degree in a related area (Finance, Accounting) ● Additional audit degrees/qualifications like CPA, CISA or if pursuing the same (preferable but not mandatory) ● 1-2 years of experience in accounting, finance, auditing, or analytics (FP&A) ● Strong analytical, audit, investigative, and problem-solving/critical thinking skills ● Outstanding project management skills and the ability to deliver in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple work streams ● Natural interpersonal skills; ability to effectively communicate across all levels of the organization and across various cultures ● Advanced skills in Excel (imperative), Word, PowerPoint and Google Suite of products ● Understanding & execution of data analytics/visualization tools & process automation ● Strong communication skills with the ability to pitch out reports to senior leadership and have productive discussions with external auditors
ABOUT NIELSEN By connecting clients to audiences, we fuel the media industry with the most accurate understanding of what people listen to and watch. To discover what audiences love, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are truly connected to their audiences, they can see the most important opportunities and accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
Job Type: Regular Primary Location: Remote

Part - Time Survey Return Clerk
Position Overview The data collection team collects all data necessary for a Scarborough delivery. The Survey Returns personnel executes day to day steps from receiving mail through electronic scanning of Nielsen materials.
Job Responsibilities • Responsible for processing daily mail of returning surveys: • Open, review, and sort product booklets, and other Nielsen materials. • Enter information from material returns by manual key entry and scanning methods into Nielsen tracking applications. • Responsible for scanning product booklets, and other Nielsen materials, from paper to electronic files. • Additional Mail processing job duties as determined by Management
Position Expectations • Attention to Details • Ability to work in a fast paced environment • Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and meet deadlines. • Ability to communicate, interact and assist co-workers when required and work in a team environment. • Ability to work independently
Position Requirements • Minimum of High School Diploma or equivalent Basic computer skills with Microsoft Excel
Physical Requirements • Ability to stand, bend, stoop, sit, walk, twist and turn • Ability to use a phone or headset • Ability to use a computer keyboard and calculator • Ability to use scanning printer • Ability to use copy machine • Ability to use industrial cutting machine • Ability to lift bundles of paper booklets - 20 pounds

item.description:
Global Nielsen Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. At the core of our data is our Field & Call Center associates, who connect and build personal relationships with consumers to collect data on TV, Radio, and Digital Device consumption.
The Panel Relations Specialist identifies ways to maintain/improve cooperation and quality of data gathered from Nielsen panelists. The position entails outbound and inbound calls to panelists, reviewing performance data, fostering positive relations and coaching panelists on proper usage of proprietary equipment.
Principle Accountabilities:
Primary customer service contact, addressing household concerns, answering questions and ensuring long-term and accurate usage of equipment. Meets outbound and inbound call metrics. Builds solid, productive panelist relationships through positive communication. Collects and analyzes data, providing feedback to panelists. Collects and maintains demographic and device information via outbound and inbound calls to ensure quality of the data. Uses recruitment resources effectively and is able to present full disclosure of participation guidelines to panelists. Investigates and resolves proprietary system generated panelist performance issues. Schedules return calls as needed with panelists. Works with support departments as needed to resolve panelist issues.
Qualifications:
In addition to a professional attitude, the successful candidate should also possess the following: Fluency in English Strong customer service and human relations skills Outbound and inbound call experience Problem solving, and performance analysis abilities Capable of working evenings and at least one weekend day each week Spanish and/or Asian bilingual skills are required Excellent organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines MS Office Suite experience (Word, Excel and Outlook) High School Diploma required, College degree or equivalent experience preferred

item.title: Audio on-Demand (Podcast) Editor, French
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Metadata drives all product lines -- all are based on data connectivity! We provide clients with a comprehensive global database of compositions, writers and publishers - linking compositions to recordings at scale using machine learning. Providing publishers, societies and entertainment services with essential reference data for rights management.
Gracenote is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world’s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path “big data.” Over the past 3 years, the company has grown to more than 2000 employees in 17 countries, including over 600 of the world’s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is one of America’s most iconic and respected media companies.
ROLE:
Collects new and updates existing entertainment data for key audio on demand (podcast) database fields. Establishes and enhances database records and assets. Maintains accurate database information for timely use in supporting current domestic and international products.

item.title: Associate Solution Manager
item.description:
As a product-led organization, Global Nielsen Media puts the product at the center of the strategy and brings cross-functional teams together to work on particular products. With over 2,800 global patents in over 80 countries, the Product team drives value with cutting-edge solutions and analytics to create insights. Be a part of creating the innovative solutions that define the media ecosystem playing field and enable media markets to function
Associate Solution Manager
At Nielsen, division Media Planning, we develop creative analytical solutions to support companies in the optimization of their marketing and communications budgets. Analytical and econometric approaches form the backbone of these solutions, answering questions like "What media mix works best to communicate my brand message?”, “What budget should I invest in media and marketing?". Our software tools and other decision-support solutions combine market research, data, modelling results and technical business intelligence.
ABOUT THE JOB
In this position, you contribute to the successful implementation of our software solutions for advertisers, media owners and media agencies. Our solutions help these companies in making decisions around their marketing communication budgets. Based upon research data combined with analytical and econometric approaches our solutions answer questions like "What budget is needed to generate an increase of 10% in brand preference? What media mix contributes the most to the revenue?
You will be working in (small) teams on the design, execution, implementation and operational management of projects. This involves analysing data, setting up surveys, designing a good way to integrate data (survey data, modelling and industry knowledge) into our software tools and maintaining contact with clients – both internal and external. In your role, you will act as a liaison between various parts of our business: analytics, data processing and software development, and have a chance to be involved in the entire project from client request and solution design to tool delivery and training.
YOUR PROFILE
● Bachelor or Master’s degree in Econometrics, Marketing Analytics, Statistics or similar with an emphasis on analytics or statistics; ● 0-2 years of experience; ● Result-driven mentality and affinity with marketing and research; ● Affinity with data, software and quantitative techniques. Coding (in python) knowledge is a plus. ● Analytical thinking combined with good social and communication skills; ● Fluent in English (speaking and writing); ● Residing in The Netherlands.
WHAT WE OFFER
● Competitive salary and benefits ● Personal and professional development opportunities ● Flexibility in working hours and location ● Exciting projects and clients ● An open, respectful and multicultural atmosphere ● Time for socialising and fun ● In the office: A Football and a Ping-pong table, and Friday afternoon drinks (every Friday) ● Daily fruit snacks ● Reimbursement of travelling expenses
● Working from home ● Weekly team stand-ups and frequent online project meetups ● Regular online team lunches and events ● Support with home office equipment ● 25 days of paid leave

item.description:

Our team of researchers come from diverse disciplines and they drive innovation, new product ideation, experimental design and testing, complex analysis and delivery of data insights around the world. We support all International Media clients and are located where our clients are.
As a leader in marketing and media information, Nielsen is one of the most trusted sources of business intelligence for the world’s top brands. The work we do makes a significant difference to how businesses and brands perform in markets around the world. At Nielsen, we all share a commitment to our core values of being useful, open, personal, and connected in how we work – with each other, our partners, and our clients.
A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU You would like to be a part of an international and multicultural team responsible for multi country projects. You are driven by curiosity and enjoy problem-solving. You are passionate about taking ownership of the client’s relationship and delivery of client ready solutions. Managing time and deadlines come naturally to you. You're committed to delivering high-quality results for your clients.
ABOUT THIS JOB We are looking for a talented Analytics Consultant that has a passion for working with clients and data, backed with strong analytical and communication skills. As an Analytics Consultant, you will play a critical role in delivering results to support international clients decision making in a reliable and efficient manner. Presentations with actionable recommendations is the final output which you deliver to the top client management team.
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A CONSULTANT: -Work as a part of an international project team that helps FMCG clients optimize their marketing mix, pricing and promotion activities -Use Nielsen tools and methodologies to build answers to business questions from the market data -Convert analysis results into a business-focused and actionable client report -Deliver insights and recommendations to the client in a presentation -Coordinate project execution between teams of experts
REQUIREMENTS: -Interested in market research and business, data-based consulting -Eager to work with numbers and have quantitative analysis skills / background -Focused on helping the client win in the market -Excited to present results of the analysis prepared -Able to effectively communicate in a cross-country environment -Fluent in Excel and PowerPoint -Fluent in English (another European Language would be an asset)
AS A NIELSEN EMPLOYEE YOU WILL: -Learn how advanced analytics is applied in real business cases -Understand FMCG environment in Europe -Be provided with professional training -Be encouraged to pursue growth opportunities in client consulting and market research -Work in an international and friendly team
YOUR OPPORTUNITY TO GROW: At Nielsen you will experience a dynamic, open, and solution-oriented international environment, where we support your development through a trust-based feedback culture and diverse training possibilities. As part of our culture, our promise to you is that at Nielsen you can: Be Yourself, Make a Difference & Grow with Us.
ABOUT NIELSEN We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.
We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries.From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what’s next with us at Nielsen: careers.nielsen.com.
Nielsen strives for an open, inclusive and tolerant working environment, where all employees are encouraged to grow and be themselves. At Nielsen, we focus on systematically integrating inclusion and accountability into the full employee experience through three focus areas: Talent, Culture and Accountability. We have 9 affinity-base communities (Business Resources Groups - BRG's) that grow an inclusive culture, drive business growth and innovation through diversity and inclusion, increase BRG participation at all levels (our CEO is Chief Diversity Officer) and enable associates to be themselves, by reaching their full potential.
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.
If this sounds good...click apply!

item.title: Analytical Consultant
item.description:
As a product-led organization, Global Nielsen Media puts the product at the center of the strategy and brings cross-functional teams together to work on particular products. With over 2,800 global patents in over 80 countries, the Product team drives value with cutting-edge solutions and analytics to create insights. Be a part of creating the innovative solutions that define the media ecosystem playing field and enable media markets to function
Analytical Consultant
At Nielsen, division Media Planning, we develop creative analytical solutions to support companies in the optimization of their marketing and communications budgets. Analytical and econometric approaches form the backbone of these solutions, answering questions like "What media mix works best to communicate my brand message?”, “What budget should I invest in media and marketing?". Our software tools and other decision-support solutions combine market research, data, modelling results and technical business intelligence.
ABOUT THE JOB
In this position, you contribute to the successful implementation of our software solutions for advertisers, media owners and media agencies. Our solutions help these companies in making decisions around their marketing communication budgets. Based upon research data combined with analytical and econometric approaches our solutions answer questions like "What budget is needed to generate an increase of 10% in brand preference? What media mix contributes the most to the revenue? You will be working in (small) teams on the design, execution, implementation and operational management of projects. This involves analysing data, setting up surveys, designing a good way to integrate data (survey data, modelling and industry knowledge) into our software tools and maintaining contact with clients – both internal and external. In your role, you will act as a liaison between various parts of our business: analytics, data processing and software development, and have a chance to be involved in the entire project from client request and solution design to tool delivery and training.
YOUR PROFILE
● Bachelor or Master’s degree in Econometrics, Marketing Analytics, Statistics or similar with an emphasis on analytics or statistics; ● 0-2 years of experience; ● Result-driven mentality and affinity with marketing and research; ● Affinity with data, software and quantitative techniques. Coding (in python) knowledge is a plus. ● Analytical thinking combined with good social and communication skills; ● Fluent in English (speaking and writing); ● Residing in The Netherlands.
WHAT WE OFFER
● Competitive salary and benefits ● Personal and professional development opportunities ● Flexibility in working hours and location ● Exciting projects and clients ● An open, respectful and multicultural atmosphere ● Time for socialising and fun ● In the office: A Football and a Ping-pong table, and Friday afternoon drinks (every Friday) ● Daily fruit snacks ● Reimbursement of travelling expenses ● Working from home ● Weekly team stand-ups and frequent online project meetups ● Regular online team lunches and events ● Support with home office equipment ● 25 days of paid leave

item.description:
The Global Nielsen Media Client Service & Sales team provides modern and effective services that meet client needs quicker, while giving Nielsen more control over how we service our clients. We will create capacity to elevate the work we do with clients to focus on market impact and business growth. We are at the forefront of customer experience and become an agent of change as we embrace automation to navigate the complex needs of our industry and continue to be the industry leader
Über uns: Nielsen Media ist einer der größten Marktforscher weltweit, spezialisiert auf Media- und Customer-Journey-Forschung. Wir analysieren Marken-, Medien- und Werbeauftritte und helfen unseren Kunden damit, überzeugende Kommunikation, Produkte und Services anzubieten. Unser Team eint die Begeisterung für professionelle und pragmatisch angewandte quantitative und qualitative Forschung. Zusammen arbeiten wir an spannenden Fragestellungen unserer Kunden. Dazu gehört häufig auch ein gemeinsames Brainstorming am Laptop oder auch mal im Kaffee nebenan, um in einer kreativen Atmosphäre die besten Lösungen für unsere Kunden zu finden.
Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir am Standort Hamburg in Vollzeit einen Analytic Consultant (m/w/d) für unseren Bereich Media Insights. Mit Media Insights bietet Nielsen die Möglichkeit, systematisch die Entwicklung der Marken- und Werbekommunikation von Branchen, Unternehmen und Produkten zu untersuchen sowie relevante Kommunikations- und Kampagnenstrategien zu analysieren.

item.description:
The Global Nielsen Media Client Service & Sales team provides modern and effective services that meet client needs quicker, while giving Nielsen more control over how we service our clients. We will create capacity to elevate the work we do with clients to focus on market impact and business growth. We are at the forefront of customer experience and become an agent of change as we embrace automation to navigate the complex needs of our industry and continue to be the industry leader
Sr Analyst, Client Consulting Reports to: Director-Client Consulting-Media Location: NY/hybrid
NCSolutions empowers the CPG ecosystem to create and deliver more effective advertising with purchase-based audiences and sales measurement solutions. We harness the unrivaled data resources of our parent companies, including our exclusive rights to the TV and digital currency data. Leveraging these assets coupled with scientific rigor and leading edge technology, we help our clients continuously improve advertising performance, everywhere their ad appears.
Why should you join the Client Consulting team at NCSolutions? Our team is comprised of media and analytics professionals who are dedicated to delivering exceptional service to our clients. We strive to attract motivated, innovative, and collaborative talent. You will find success on this team by leveraging your outstanding analytical problem-solving, communication and relationship-building skills to deliver top quality work to our clients.
We’re hiring a motivated and collaborative candidate to join NCSolutions as Sr. Analyst on the Client Consulting team. The Client Consulting team works directly with our traditional and advanced TV clients. The Sr. Analyst will have the opportunity to work directly with major networks and other content distributors, assisting with developing and delivering actionable media insights and recommendations that are aligned with sales and research objectives.
RESPONSIBILITIES: ⦁Interact with client contacts by answering questions and performing data reports/quality assurance. ⦁Attend client meetings to understand client business objectives. Identify and communicate client needs to appropriate client consulting team members ⦁Pull and analyze NCS data and deliver insights and recommendations to clients ⦁Independently manage basic workflows within the targeting and measurement processes independently, engaging with many stakeholders both externally and internally to ensure timely and accurate delivery of work ⦁Respond to ad-hoc data requests, answer questions, and provide basic technical support and analysis ⦁Support client needs in a timely and efficient manner demonstrating a sense of urgency, tenacity, and commitment to quality and excellent client service ⦁Engage other NCS teams as needed in order to proactively resolve client issues ⦁Other duties as assigned
DESIRED EXPERIENCE: ⦁2-4 years’ experience in the media/TV or ad tech industry, preferably in a client facing role
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS: ⦁Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field ⦁Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office and/or Google Sheets ⦁Strong analytical aptitude and problem-solving skills ⦁Ability to independently manage, prioritize, and deliver on multiple client demands with consistent quality and excellence ⦁Ability to think through and identify alternative approaches to challenging questions/issues ⦁Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to articulate information effectively

item.title: Analyst-Data Operations-9
item.description:
The Global Nielsen Media Client Service & Sales team provides modern and effective services that meet client needs quicker, while giving Nielsen more control over how we service our clients. We will create capacity to elevate the work we do with clients to focus on market impact and business growth. We are at the forefront of customer experience and become an agent of change as we embrace automation to navigate the complex needs of our industry and continue to be the industry leader
About The Role:
To be employed as an Analyst - Data Operations in a media evaluation and reporting setup. Get trained and execute acquired instructions to report brand exposures/iterations from sports or non-sport media content (video or images) with strict adherence to timelines
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Deliver work basis standard targets set (time or measure of unprocessed work) differs from department to department. A Trainee analyst would be required to browse through video content (mostly sports-related) with an eye-for-detail when it comes to picking all legible brand exposures. Ability to work effectively with management and part of a team to meet targets. Strong attention to detail.
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS
Graduate Good communication skills (Comprehension of written/verbal instructions in English)
Preferred Skills
Knowledge of different Sports, sporting events, TV channels and TV shows Ability to work with MS Excel and/or Google sheets
Desired Skills:
Eye for detail, Logical thought process Adaptability and quick learning abilities Basic computer and keyboard skills + Basic analytical skills
ABOUT THE TEAM
Nielsen Sports is the premier provider of analytics and insights within the sports industry, offering the most reliable source of independent and holistic market data in the sector and the most complete view of consumer trends and habits worldwide. We combine solutions from sponsorship effectiveness to fan data capabilities with Nielsens understanding of consumer behavior and media consumption, allowing major brands, teams and sports organizations, and over 1,700 customers globally to better understand and connect with audiences through media, sponsorship, communication and experiential platforms.
As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what's true, we measure across all channels and platforms from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You'll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

We will create capacity to elevate the work we do with clients to focus on market impact and business growth. We are at the forefront of customer experience and become an agent of change as we embrace automation to navigate the complex needs of our industry and continue to be the industry leader
About The Role:
To be employed as an Analyst - Data Operations in a media evaluation and reporting setup. Get trained and execute acquired instructions to report brand exposures/iterations from sports or non-sport media content (video or images) with strict adherence to timelines
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Deliver work basis standard targets set (time or measure of unprocessed work) differs from department to department. A Trainee analyst would be required to browse through video content (mostly sports-related) with an eye-for-detail when it comes to picking all legible brand exposures. Ability to work effectively with management and part of a team to meet targets. Strong attention to detail.
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS
Graduate Good communication skills (Comprehension of written/verbal instructions in English)
Preferred Skills
Knowledge of different Sports, sporting events, TV channels and TV shows Ability to work with MS Excel and/or Google sheets
Desired Skills:
Eye for detail, Logical thought process Adaptability and quick learning abilities Basic computer and keyboard skills + Basic analytical skills
ABOUT THE TEAM
Nielsen Sports is the premier provider of analytics and insights within the sports industry, offering the most reliable source of independent and holistic market data in the sector and the most complete view of consumer trends and habits worldwide. We combine solutions from sponsorship effectiveness to fan data capabilities with Nielsens understanding of consumer behavior and media consumption, allowing major brands, teams and sports organizations, and over 1,700 customers globally to better understand and connect with audiences through media, sponsorship, communication and experiential platforms.
As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what's true, we measure across all channels and platforms from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.

item.title: Analyst-Data Operations-01
item.description:
Gracenote, a Nielsen Media company, provides entertainment metadata and technology that powers the world’s top cable and satellite providers, consumer electronics, automakers and music services. Deliver work basis standard targets set (time or measure of unprocessed work) differs from department to department. A Trainee analyst would be required to browse through video content (mostly sports-related) with an eye-for-detail when it comes to picking all legible brand exposures. Ability to work effectively with management and part of a team to meet targets. Strong attention to detail.
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS
Graduate Good communication skills (Comprehension of written/verbal instructions in English)
Preferred Skills
Knowledge of different Sports, sporting events, TV channels and TV shows Ability to work with MS Excel and/or Google sheets
Desired Skills:
Eye for detail, Logical thought process Adaptability and quick learning abilities Basic computer and keyboard skills + Basic analytical skills
ABOUT THE TEAM
Nielsen Sports is the premier provider of analytics and insights within the sports industry, offering the most reliable source of independent and holistic market data in the sector and the most complete view of consumer trends and habits worldwide. We combine solutions from sponsorship effectiveness to fan data capabilities with Nielsens understanding of consumer behavior and media consumption, allowing major brands, teams and sports organizations, and over 1,700 customers globally to better understand and connect with audiences through media, sponsorship, communication and experiential platforms.
As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what's true, we measure across all channels and platforms from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You'll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

Data Science is at the core of Nielsen’s business. En esta función, trabajará en estrecha colaboración con nuestros equipos de Data y Marketing Effectiveness para brindar con éxito información de datos para abordar las preguntas comerciales complejas de nuestros clientes.

The Client Solution Executive is a member of the Nielsen Client Service team, dedicated to servicing Advertising Agencies and Advertisers in the Central region of the United States. The scope of the client service function ranges from understanding and selling Nielsen’s national and local audience measurement and consumer insight services, contract negotiating, addressing in-bound calls regarding ratings and advertising data inquiries, understanding consumer viewership and listenership behaviors. item.description:

Account Executive Reports to: VP of Business Development (TV vertical) Location: New York Manages: None
When brands ask “Is my advertising working? Am I reaching the right audiences? Are my efforts driving incremental sales? Which of my efforts are driving the most sales among a particular buyer group?” – they turn to NCS for solutions. With an unrivaled 10+ years of experience advancing advertising, we help brands and media sellers improve their advertising effectiveness on every platform, channel and device. Our research-based insights, collective wisdom and proven techniques help clients target the right segments based on in-store purchase behaviors, optimize campaigns while in-flight and measure the resulting incremental sales. As a strategic partner, we ensure our clients are always at the forefront of advertising effectiveness.
NCS is looking for an Account Executive to play a key role in NCS’ sales efforts with TV networks and major streaming providers and platforms across the U.S. This individual will be responsible for creating strategic partnerships with specific broadcast networks, MVPDs and streaming platforms (Roku, HULU, SamsungAds, Pluto.TV etc). These relationships should result in preferred partnerships, ensure successful NCS annual revenue targets and show curated long-term growth. The ideal candidate will develop and own strategies for scaling each client relationship to co-develop go-to-market engagements which maximize NCS revenue. We need someone that can work collaboratively with cross-functional NCS resources to assemble custom go-to-market solutions for each respective client. This candidate will be able to work across multiple client teams: investment, strategy, activation, planning and analytics.
Responsibilities:
Business Development: *Identify and implement sales prospecting at relevant, TV clients leveraging CPG advertisers *Build and manage a robust and scalable sales pipeline. *Lead pricing conversations and maintain consistent pricing and discounts across all constituents. *Meet and exceed quarterly and annual revenue goals and quotas. *Establish new revenue growth opportunities. *Maintain up-to-date prospect and client revenue opportunities in the CRM system including complete contact information, call reports, correspondence, price quotes and agreements.
Leadership: *Deliver impactful communication about NCS with target prospects through compelling benefit-oriented letters, phone calls and presentations. *Quick on their feet, crafting the right response to challenging questions and tough issues. *Identify opportunities for better collaboration within cross-functional NCS teams
Qualifications: *Strong industry relationships to accelerate revenue growth. *Challenger/strategic sales and business development competency. *Bachelor’s degree *Master’s degree or MBA is a plus. *Proven knowledge of the TV ecosystem, experience in audience data selling and measurement is a plus. *Comfort and proficiency in consultative selling, being able to triangulate the conversations between Agencies and Advertisers. *Well-developed knowledge of media and data in the CPG industry with both advertisers and media agencies.
Experience: *Experience within the overarching media space, ideally with TV/Cable focus *Experience operating within a data-driven sales role *Mid-level sales professional with experience monetizing cross-platform data driven solutions.

item.description:

이곳에서 인재로 등록하시면, 여러분께 가장 적합한 포지션으로 우선 연락 드리고 있습니다. 본 공고는 상시채용을 위한 인재풀로 활용되며, 별도의 마감 일정이나 세부 지원자격이 없습니다. 등록해주신 이력서는 비정기적으로 검토되며, 이후 채용 단계로 모실 수 있는 분에 한해 개별 연락 드리고 있습니다. 해당 공고에 지원하신 후 타 포지션에 중복하여 지원하실 수 있습니다.
